definition: Shanghai Stock Exchange (SSE), abbr. for 上海證券交易所|上海证券交易所[Shang4 hai3 Zheng4 quan4 Jiao1 yi4 suo3]
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]

pinyin: Shang4 zheng4 zong1 he2 zhi3 shu4

sentences.english: Shanghai i Securities News reported, to combat escaped and revoked debts has become an important task for the current banking industry.
sentences.chinese: 上证报消息，打击逃废债已成当前银行业的重要任务。

sentences.english: The new SSE is planned as a financial center with civic meaning.
sentences.chinese: 上证所的新计划作为一个金融中心，公民的含义。

sentences.english: China Post, the official postal service of China, plans to list its shares in Shanghai or Shenzhen next year.
sentences.chinese: 中国邮政计划于明年在上证或深证上市。

sentences.english: Finally, the sources of multifractal spectrums of Shanghai stock and Shenzhen stock are analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 最后研究了上证指数和深证指数的多重分形成因。

definition: stock market index/share price index/abbr. for 股票指數|股票指数[gu3 piao4 zhi3 shu4]
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
to shake up/to jolt/to vibrate/to oscillate/to fluctuate
(of a stock price or market index) currently higher than at the previous day's close
market price/quotation of market price/the current market situation
(of a market index etc) to fall below (a given level)/to be injured or damaged as a result of a fall
